title: Why won’t my till Z-Read during a test?
text: Q) - Why won’t my till Z-Read during a test, it will not allow me to press any buttons or change and values ? A) - A till will not allow someone to Z-read if in Training mode.
description:
Q) - Why won’t my till Z-Read during a test, it will not allow me to press any buttons or change and values ?


A) - A till will not allow someone to Z-read if in Training mode.

title: Do tills need to be finalised before it can be reused ?
text: Q) - Question about the tills, at the end of the day they z read and cash up and close the drawer, there is an internal conflict where some believe that a till must be finalised before it is reused on a different day. Others believe that as long as it is closed it can be reused? A) - drawers do not need to be finalized but do need to be closed to be reused.
description:
Q) - Question about the tills, at the end of the day they z read and cash up and close the drawer, there is an internal conflict where some believe that a till must be finalised before it is reused on a different day. Others believe that as long as it is closed it can be reused?


A) - drawers do not need to be finalized but do need to be closed to be reused.

title: Can the Float value be changed when opening a cash drawer ?
text: Q) - Why has my standard opening float value changed and can It be changed back to the standard £200? A) - The Default Opening Float is just a default value, and can still be overridden in the tills screen when the cash drawer is opened in the below screen.
description:
Q) - Why has my standard opening float value changed and can It be changed back to the standard £200?


A) - The Default Opening Float is just a default value, and can still be overridden in the tills screen when the cash drawer is opened in the below screen.

title: How do I update a till when its opened from the back office ?
text: Q) - When opening a till through the back office no epos four button screen shows e.g. the update till button is not there, How can I update the till opened from the back office? A) - As long as the users has recreated till date through the back office any virtual till opened in it will be fully up to date already and there is no need for a update button to appear.
description:
Q) - When opening a till through the back office no epos four button screen shows e.g. the update till button is not there, How can I update the till opened from the back office?


A) - As long as the users has recreated till date through the back office any virtual till opened in it will be fully up to date already and there is no need for a update button to appear.

title: Receipts/Kitchen Order Slips Not Printing Correctly After Being Set In Till Configuration
text: If you have changed or set a printer up on a till for the first time in Till Configuration, and the document does not print correctly, this could be due to the new printer assigned to the till may be an OPOS printer, and the new one might be installed via Windows, which means the printer would need OPOS/Windows documents, as they cannot be used interchangeably. your first test would be to go into Till Configuration, Alter Default Till Documents and tick and untick all options, making sure you set the non-default document designs back to the original one. Then recreate till data and update the till. Then try printing the same document again, to see if the document is displaying better.
description:
If you have changed or set a printer up on a till for the first time in Till Configuration, and the document does not print correctly, this could be due to the new printer assigned to the till may be an OPOS printer, and the new one might be installed via Windows, which means the printer would need OPOS/Windows documents, as they cannot be used interchangeably.


 your first test would be to go into Till Configuration, Alter Default Till Documents and tick and untick all options, making sure you set the non-default document designs back to the original one. Then recreate till data and update the till. Then try printing the same document again, to see if the document is displaying better.

title: Cannot Log In With Till Operators PIN
text: If you cannot log in with your till login PIN, then your best option is to get your PIN reset. This can be performed by a System Administrator user on your site. Once the System Administrator has logged in, they then need to go to Setup, Users, find and select the user within the list, then click Change..., type in a new PIN into both fields, Ok, Save. You will then need to recreate till data (click to understand how to do this), and update your tills in order for them to pick up this update, to then be able to log into the till with your new PIN.
description:
If you cannot log in with your till login PIN, then your best option is to get your PIN reset. This can be performed by a System Administrator user on your site.


Once the System Administrator has logged in, they then need to go to Setup, Users, find and select the user within the list, then click Change..., type in a new PIN into both fields, Ok, Save. 


You will then need to recreate till data (click to understand how to do this), and update your tills in order for them to pick up this update, to then be able to log into the till with your new PIN.

title: Online Shop Stock Quantity
text: By default online stock quantity is calculated from the total stock in ALL stock locations. This can be changed however you will need to request this change from the support team.
description:
By default online stock quantity is calculated from the total stock in ALL stock locations. 


This can be changed however you will need to request this change from the support team.

title: Item Has No Valid Price When Selling Item Or Redeeming Booking
text: Issue If you are selling an item or redeeming a booking, and you receive the below message. This means the item you are selling does not have a valid price for today, or the day you have chosen to sell this on. Resolution To resolve this issue: Find the item within Price Lookup Index in the MStore Back Office. Open the PLU Maintenance screen for this item (A quick giveaway for the cause can be due to the Current List Price showing as No Valid Price). Click View/Add Price. Within the Price History screen, make sure there is a valid price showing for today, or the date you are trying to sell this item for. We recommend adding 10 years on most PLU's to reduce how common this issue occurs. Do not allow price breaks valid from and to dates to overlap, as this can cause adverse issues Click Apply. Recreate till data (Instructions on this can be found here: How To Recreate Till Data In MStore Back Office), and update the tills affected. When you next open the till program, you can now sell this item.
description:
Issue

If you are selling an item or redeeming a booking, and you receive the below message. This means the item you are selling does not have a valid price for today, or the day you have chosen to sell this on.



Resolution

To resolve this issue:

  1. Find the item within Price Lookup Index in the MStore Back Office.
  2. Open the PLU Maintenance screen for this item (A quick giveaway for the cause can be due to the Current List Price showing as No Valid Price).
  3. Click View/Add Price.
  4. Within the Price History screen, make sure there is a valid price showing for today, or the date you are trying to sell this item for. We recommend adding 10 years on most PLU's to reduce how common this issue occurs.

    Do not allow price breaks valid from and to dates to overlap, as this can cause adverse issues
  5. Click Apply.
  6. Recreate till data (Instructions on this can be found here: How To Recreate Till Data In MStore Back Office), and update the tills affected.

When you next open the till program, you can now sell this item.

title: How to check what version of MStore you are using.
Simple till button editing
text: So if you are on the till screen and hold Ctrl + right click on a panel it will bring up the below screen. Once on this screen you can right click on the button you wish to configure. This will then bring up the below screen where you can edit the specific buttons. Then change the switch panel to the panel you want to change when the button is pushed and then the box at the bottom pick which panel it will be. Down the left hand side of the tab you can change the behavior of what the till button does. The switch panel will change the panel on button press. The other ones will perform different actions. For further support you can request the training manual from support or on the K3 training materials website.
description:
So if you are on the till screen and hold Ctrl + right click on a panel it will bring up the below screen.


Once on this screen you can right click on the button you wish to configure.

This will then bring up the below screen where you can edit the specific buttons. 


Then change the switch panel to the panel you want to change when the button is pushed and then the box at the bottom pick which panel it will be.


Down the left hand side of the tab you can change the behavior  of what the till button does. The switch panel will change the panel on button press. The other ones will perform different actions. For further support you can request the training manual from support or on the K3 training materials website.

title: How do I access the Support Portal from the till?
text: When you first start up the till, there is a large button which you use to start the POS. One of those buttons will take you to the Support Portal as shown below. If you do not see the button, then please raise a Service Request / Software Delivery Request ticket to request the update (which will only update this screen; not the overall version of MStore which you have).
description:
When you first start up the till, there is a large button which you use to start the POS. One of those buttons will take you to the Support Portal as shown below.


If you do not see the button, then please raise a Service Request / Software Delivery Request ticket to request the update (which will only update this screen; not the overall version of MStore which you have).

title: How To Change When Your Receipts Print In POS
text: If you would like to change how your receipts print, you can change this in the MStore Back Office by following the below instructions: Click on Setup, Till Configuration. Select your till in the drop-down (3). Choose one of the following options to change when receipts print (4): Don't Print - Do not print any receipts when completing a transaction. Print - Always print a receipts when completing a transaction. Prompt to Print - Prompt the till operator whether to print a receipt when completing a transaction. Print But Not Zero - Only print a receipt if the value of the transaction does not equal £0. Prompt to Email - Prompt the till operator to send this receipt to the requested email address (This will require chargeable setup before this functionality can be used. Please enquire with your account manager if you would like more information on this). Click Apply and Close. Finally, recreate till data to push the update down to the till. To understand how to do this, please follow this Knowledge Base article: How To Recreate Till Data In MStore Back Office.
description:
If you would like to change how your receipts print, you can change this in the MStore Back Office by following the below instructions:


  1. Click on Setup, Till Configuration.
     
  2. Select your till in the drop-down (3).
  3. Choose one of the following options to change when receipts print (4):
    • Don't Print - Do not print any receipts when completing a transaction.
    • Print - Always print a receipts when completing a transaction.
    • Prompt to Print - Prompt the till operator whether to print a receipt when completing a transaction.
    • Print But Not Zero - Only print a receipt if the value of the transaction does not equal £0.
    • Prompt to Email - Prompt the till operator to send this receipt to the requested email address (This will require chargeable setup before this functionality can be used. Please enquire with your account manager if you would like more information on this).
  4. Click Apply and Close.
     
  5. Finally, recreate till data to push the update down to the till. To understand how to do this, please follow this Knowledge Base article: How To Recreate Till Data In MStore Back Office.

title: "The Server Update Process Has Stopped - OK To Restart It?" When Performing Transactions On Till On 3.14
text: After performing a transaction in version 3.14 of the MStore POS software, and you receive the below message, please follow the below instructions. First, go to C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac and right-click on PMStore.exe. Click on Properties in the contextual menu. Within Properties, click on the Compatibility tab make sure Compatibility mode is ticked and set to Windows 7, and tick Run this program as an administrator. Click Apply and OK. Right-click on PMStorePOS.exe in the same folder location. Click on Properties, then Compatibility tab. Set Compatibility mode to Windows 7 only. Click Apply and OK. If there is still an issue, have a look at replacing the C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac\PServerUpdate.exe with a known working version from another till.
description:
After performing a transaction in version 3.14 of the MStore POS software, and you receive the below message, please follow the below instructions.



  1. First, go to C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac and right-click on PMStore.exe. 
  2. Click on Properties in the contextual menu. 
  3. Within Properties, click on the Compatibility tab make sure Compatibility mode is ticked and set to Windows 7, and tick Run this program as an administrator. 
  4. Click Apply and OK.
  5. Right-click on PMStorePOS.exe in the same folder location.
  6. Click on Properties, then Compatibility tab.
  7.  Set Compatibility mode to Windows 7 only.
  8. Click Apply and OK.


If there is still an issue, have a look at replacing the C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac\PServerUpdate.exe with a known working version from another till.

title: Return Visit Search Functionality
text: The Return Visit Search functionality can be used to find, view, edit, cancel and reprint return visit tickets. You can search for return visits using their name, postcode or email, as you can see below, and then select the return visit in the list. Please note, you cannot redeem Return visits directly from the Return Visit search screen when you select OK on the selected return visit. You will need to reprint the return visit ticket, and scan this in, which is explained further down this article. Once you have searched and selected the return visit in question with the up and down arrows to the right of the screen, you can click Edit to view the details of the selected return visit. From here, you can view, edit, cancel and reprint the return visit. Reprinting the ticket will allow you to redeem the return visit by scanning the barcode on the ticket into the basket on the till program. Please note, when you redeem return visits, nothing will populate in the customer/account section of the till program, as return visits are not a customer account. To view the free webinar video on the Return Visit functionality, please visit this link: Return Visits Webinar.
description:
The Return Visit Search functionality can be used to find, view, edit, cancel and reprint return visit tickets. You can search for return visits using their name, postcode or email, as you can see below, and then select the return visit in the list. Please note, you cannot redeem Return visits directly from the Return Visit search screen when you select OK on the selected return visit. You will need to reprint the return visit ticket, and scan this in, which is explained further down this article.



Once you have searched and selected the return visit in question with the up and down arrows to the right of the screen, you can click Edit to view the details of the selected return visit.



From here, you can view, edit, cancel and reprint the return visit. Reprinting the ticket will allow you to redeem the return visit by scanning the barcode on the ticket into the basket on the till program. Please note, when you redeem return visits, nothing will populate in the customer/account section of the till program, as return visits are not a customer account.



To view the free webinar video on the Return Visit functionality, please visit this link: Return Visits Webinar.

title: Which Till's Can See Layaways?
text: Any till that is in the same department/sub-department as the till that lays a layaway away will be able to see and recall the layaway. Departments are set in the Till Configuration screen.
description:
Any till that is in the same department/sub-department as the till that lays a layaway away will be able to see and recall the layaway.


Departments are set in the Till Configuration screen.

title: Till reboots when a cashdrawer number is inserted.
text: Very odd issue experienced recently where the POS appears to work fine. That is until you try to enter a cash drawer number after logging into the POS. This appeared to be an issue with the physical cash drawer itself. By disabling the cash drawer in Till Configuration in BO (setting cash Drawer1 to None. Then recreate till data for that till. Select the correct till
description:
Very odd issue experienced recently where the POS appears to work fine.

That is until you try to enter a cash drawer number after logging into the POS.


This appeared to be an issue with the physical cash drawer itself.

By disabling the cash drawer in Till Configuration in BO (setting cash Drawer1 to None.

Then recreate till data for that till.



Select the correct till

title: Run time error fix
text: When opening the POS you may get the following error. A run time error. This first thing to do is to run the installer and perform a repair on the software. This should work the majority of the time and correct the issue.
description:
When opening the POS you may get the following error. A run time error.


This first thing to do is to run the installer and perform a repair on the software. This should work the majority of the time and correct the issue.

title: Setting up .Net App For Kitchen Printing
text: If you are experiencing issues with kitchen printing via the default Windows kitchen printing functionality, there is now a dedicated application that handles this to improve performance. This application will be pushed out to all tills as part of a standard MStore system upgrade. Before setting this up, you will need to make sure you on MStore version 3.19.6 or later. Once you are on an eligible version, please follow the below steps to set this up: Within the Back Office, go to Setup (1), Till Configuration (2). Within the Till Configuration screen, choose the till (3) you would like to enable .Net kitchen printing, then tick Use .Net app for Kitchen Print (4), then Apply (5). Do the above for each till that you would like this setup on. Finally, recreate till data and update your till. If you launch the POS and receive the below error, this will be due to critical files are missing. Please contact support by logging a ticket here.
description:
If you are experiencing issues with kitchen printing via the default Windows kitchen printing functionality, there is now a dedicated application that handles this to improve performance. This application will be pushed out to all tills as part of a standard MStore system upgrade.


Before setting this up, you will need to make sure you on MStore version 3.19.6 or later.


Once you are on an eligible version, please follow the below steps to set this up:

  1. Within the Back Office, go to Setup (1), Till Configuration (2).

  2. Within the Till Configuration screen, choose the till (3) you would like to enable .Net kitchen printing, then tick Use .Net app for Kitchen Print (4), then Apply (5).


  3. Do the above for each till that you would like this setup on.

  4. Finally, recreate till data and update your till.

If you launch the POS and receive the below error, this will be due to critical files are missing. Please contact support by logging a ticket here.

title: MeracUpdater warning.
text: Occasionally, the MeracUpdater may stop running on the till. When this happens, transactions will not update to the database, causing the till to malfunction and transactions to remain stuck. To resolve this issue: Restart the Till: A simple shutdown and restart of the till often resolves the issue without requiring support intervention. Contact Support: If restarting the till does not work, support can manually restart the MeracUpdater service in the system services. Following these steps should help restore normal till functionality.
description:
Occasionally, the MeracUpdater may stop running on the till. When this happens, transactions will not update to the database, causing the till to malfunction and transactions to remain stuck.

To resolve this issue:

  1. Restart the Till: A simple shutdown and restart of the till often resolves the issue without requiring support intervention.

  2. Contact Support: If restarting the till does not work, support can manually restart the MeracUpdater service in the system services.

Following these steps should help restore normal till functionality.

title: PLU upgrades not firing on the POS
text: In order for PLU upgrades to fire at the POS, all qualifying memberships must be created using the membership wizard. Selecting the individual PLU's into the basket will not cause the upgrade to fire. Further, all qualifying memberships must be completed using the one wizard as shown below. After completing the first membership enter / swipe the next card and complete the next one. Do this until qualifying memberships have been entered. The complete the wizard. Completing a separate wizard for each membership will not fire the PLU upgrade. When all qualifying memberships are entered into the wizard and finish is selected the upgrade price (and its PLU) will be shown. Once complete the PLU will be sent to the basket.
description:
In order for PLU upgrades to fire at the POS, all qualifying memberships must be created using the membership wizard.

Selecting the individual PLU's into the basket will not cause the upgrade to fire.

Further, all qualifying memberships must be completed using the one wizard as shown below.


 

After completing the first membership enter / swipe the next card and complete the next one.

Do this until qualifying memberships have been entered.

The complete the wizard.

Completing a separate wizard for each membership will not fire the PLU upgrade.


When all qualifying memberships are entered into the wizard and finish is selected the upgrade price (and its PLU) will be shown.

 


Once complete the PLU will be sent to the basket.

title: Updating the line display image / video
text: The line display video is found within the C:\ProgramFiles(x86)\Merac folder: Same process for an image however using a video as an example. To replace the video / image on a single till you can simple replace this file (Stop the MeracLineDisplay first) ------------------- Using MeracUpdater to update all tills. On the server you can an entry into Mstore Updater (Please ask a support operative to do this) To update the file, you can drop the updated image / video into the merac data share on the server: Meracdata\updatenewver\cache Ensure the new video is named exactly the same (otherwise it won't be picked up by the updater service) Delete LineDisplay.7z Within Mstore Updater click the 2nd button from the left: This HAS to be done from the server: Click Ok to update the LineDisplay.wmv: Please click cancel on all other files that it prompts about. Close the MStore Updater window and re-open it. It should now show with the updated time and date of the line display file. Click this button to authorise the server to copy down the files: Click this one to force the update to the tills: The line display image will now be updated on the tills when the till is restarted. It will not be able to overwrite the file while the line display program is running. Any problems please contact support.
description:
The line display video is found within the C:\ProgramFiles(x86)\Merac folder:



Same process for an image however using a video as an example. 


To replace the video / image on a single till you can simple replace this file (Stop the MeracLineDisplay first)


-------------------


Using MeracUpdater to update all tills. 


On the server you can an entry into Mstore Updater



(Please ask a support operative to do this)


To update the file, you can drop the updated image / video into the merac data share on the server:


Meracdata\updatenewver\cache



Ensure the new video is named exactly the same (otherwise it won't be picked up by the updater service)


Delete LineDisplay.7z



Within Mstore Updater click the 2nd button from the left:



This HAS to be done from the server:



Click Ok to update the LineDisplay.wmv:



Please click cancel on all other files that it prompts about. 



Close the MStore Updater window and re-open it. It should now show with the updated time and date of the line display file. 


Click this button to authorise the server to copy down the files:



Click this one to force the update to the tills:



The line display image will now be updated on the tills when the till is restarted. 

It will not be able to overwrite the file while the line display program is running. 


Any problems please contact support.
